Caption: Table 2. Average errors (angle between true and estimated vec- tors) in degrees for DOA estimation methods . Errors are com- puted for three cases: combined (all time delays are used), fail- ure (only time-delays after sensor failure) and proper (only time delays before the failure). LS-solution in proper operation is the reference, marked in bold.

DOA estimation performance was analyzed by measuring the
angle between true and estimated propagation vectors, and com-
puting the average error as well as the cumulative distribution of
error. These metrics were computed for two cases: combined, in
which all DOA estimates were used and failure, where only esti-
mates after sensor failure were used. The average errors in degrees
